image.altText: A woman stands under an underpass.

props.synopsis: Bron survived repeated sessions of gay conversion attempts under the instruction of her mother but it took a heavy toll. She says a new draft bill proposed for Tasmania will do nothing to stop such "therapy" from continuing.

title.children: 'Not the legislation we wanted': Gay 'conversion therapy' survivor dismayed at bill purported to ban the practice

image.altText: Snow man near a ski field.

props.synopsis: For generations, Tasmanians have made the steep drive to Ben Lomond to enjoy the ski fields. But as seasons change and the snow disappears, those days may be numbered â€” with a report recommending government help to make snow "does not proceed".

title.children: Government told spending money on snow-making at ski field 'not viable' due to climate change

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation into the financial disclosures of sustainable or ethical-labelled super options finds extensive investment in shares of companies in the fossil fuel, gambling, alcohol and weapons manufacturing industries.

title.children: How $1 billion of ethical retirement savings ended up with oil, gas and coal companies

image.altText: a large tree lying on its side with its roots outside of the ground in the main street of a town

props.synopsis: The system has been slowly tracking inland with concerns it could re-intensify as it moves towards the Gulf of Carpentaria over the weekend. Follow live.

title.children: Far North Queenslanders begin to assess the damage as ex-Tropical Cyclone Jasper tracks inland

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Eighteen people safe after swift water rescue in Mossman

image.altText: A 10-metre bare-metal boat with small cabin on the back of a boat trailer.

props.synopsis: Police say they have made Tasmania's largest-ever seizure of cocaine and meth, after intercepting a boat that came ashore in a remote Tasmanian shack community.

title.children: Victorian boat arrival in Tasmanian shack community leads to state's largest cocaine, meth bust

image.altText: Hazem Sabwai with his son Kareem in Gaza.

props.synopsis: Since the end of the ceasefire, seven people with Australian visas and passports have had their name on the Rafah Border Crossing list to leave Gaza.

title.children: Kareem Sabwai was killed at 10, now his family needs to be on the 'list' to make it to Australia

image.altText: A map of some Hobart suburbs with different coloured shapes according to bushfire risk.

props.synopsis: Surrounded by bush and with hills and valleys, the Greater Hobart area presents a challenge for fire preparation. A new tool shows residents the risks they face.

title.children: Hobart faces worsening fire danger. This tool shows which areas are most at risk

image.altText: Man wearing traditional Emirati clothing walks past a big saying which reads #COP28

props.synopsis: The key takeaways from the summit are a transition away from fossil fuels, a tripling of renewable energy and committing to stop adding carbon dioxide to the atmosphere by mid-century.

title.children: COP28 summit wraps up with fossil fuels and renewable energy at forefront of global leaders' minds

image.altText: A young white woman with long dark hair sitting on a couch with a beagle

props.synopsis: Facilities and services providing cosmetic surgery will be forced to comply with new national standards released today as part of a suite of crackdowns on the industry by regulators.

title.children: New rules proposed as woman says she wasn't informed about risks of cosmetic surgery

image.altText: Lisa Wilkinson, in a light pink suit, walks with her lawyer.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann is suing Lisa Wilkinson and Network Ten over a 2021 The Project interview in which Brittany Higgins alleged she was raped at Parliament House.

title.children: Lisa Wilkinson to enter the witness box for the first time in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation trial

image.altText: A collection of credit cards.

props.synopsis: Experts say it's easier than you think for cybercriminals to guess your credit card details. And it's costing customers and small businesses.Â

title.children: What's a BIN attack and how are cybercriminals guessing your credit card number?

image.altText: A woman and a man lean over a bench and speak to another woman while a man makes a speech in the background

props.synopsis: There have been some frenzied days in Tasmania's parliament, but this was peak chaos â€” parliament recalled from summer break to suspend a judge charged with assault and abuse, only for the Liberal government to decide the best option was to do nothing,Â writes Adam Langenberg.

title.children: Tasmanian parliament suspends itself instead of judge charged with assault

image.altText: A generic image of an engineered stone kitchen bench in a modern kitchen.

props.synopsis: This week, Australia became the first country in the world to announce a ban on engineered stone. We look at why it's being banned, what alternatives there are, and what it could mean for your next home renovation.

title.children: Engineered stone has been banned due to the silicosis risk. What happens next?

props.synopsis: Kathleen Folbigg is expected to learn today whether her convictions will be overturned by the Court of Criminal Appeal.

title.children: Once labelled Australia's worst female serial killer, Kathleen Folbigg is expected to learn fate today

image.altText: Jim Chalmers and Katy Gallagher talk while walking in a parliament house corridor

props.synopsis: Economists say luck is offering Labor plenty of good economic fortunes. Treasurer Jim Chalmers doesn't see it that way but won't be complaining if it continues.

title.children: Chalmers's surplus victory lap doesn't mean much for cost-of-living relief, yet

image.altText: floodwaters on the streets of Cairns

props.synopsis: Heavy rain has been falling for much of the night across parts on Far North Queensland after ex-Tropical Cyclone Jasper crossed the coast near Wujal Wujal.

title.children: Heavy rain and floods the focus after ex-Tropical Cyclone Jasper crosses Far North Queensland coast

image.altText: A group of men and women dressed in medieval outfits holding large bows and arrows

props.synopsis: The Middle Ages have a very bad reputation. Here's what this period of history was really like.

title.children: Dragons aside, were the Middle Ages really like Game of Thrones?

image.altText: Man in suit speaks with group of soldiers in green and wearing balclavas

props.synopsis: Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh says any plan for post-war Gaza without Hamas is just a "delusion." It comes as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu tells soldiers they will fight "until the end" regardless of international support.

title.children: Netanyahu vows to continue war amid global ceasefire calls as Hamas chief says post-war plans without group a 'delusion'

image.altText: Older man wearing a blue and grey checkered shirt standing on a farm.

props.synopsis: Arnold Dix was in Europe when he received a call about the tunnel's collapse from India's chief engineer. He was instrumental in getting all of the trapped workers out alive.

title.children: Meet the 'nerdy' Aussie farmer behind the Indian tunnel rescue that saved 41 people

image.altText: Mono Go Head 1

props.synopsis: Monopoly Go has earnt more than $1 billion in revenue since release but a recent promotion referencing a Dreamtime story has been slammed for a lack of consultation with First Nations people.

title.children: 'Did you even stop to consult anyone Aboriginal?': US game studio faces questions over use of Indigenous culture

image.altText: shelves of food with the products smashed on the ground.

props.synopsis: After their business in a small town was broken into for the second time, Josh and Samantha feel defenceless to criminals. There are growing concerns about the low police presence in small communities and calls for the state government to intervene.Â

title.children: 'We have a very, very thin blue line' : Calls to boost police numbers in Victorian towns

image.altText: Droughty Point proposal composite thumbnail

props.synopsis: Plans to build 2,500 new homes in Hobart fell at the first hurdle earlier this year. But now the project has been given the green light by council, with proponents claiming it will "transform" the area.Â

title.children: Council greenlights plan to build 2,500 homes on Hobart's eastern shore

image.altText: A man leans over the open bonnet of a car and looks inside

props.synopsis: Rodents can cause vehicles to be written off entirely by gnawing through wiring and casings â€” and it's more common than you may think.

title.children: If you've parked your car in the bush, it's likely you may have had a secret visitor. They can cause more damage than you imagine

image.altText: Emma Richards wears a black tshirt and stands in front of a services australia building with a carpark.

props.synopsis: The incorrect attribution has upset the local Barngarla people, who say the wording looked like "a cut and paste job'" with little cultural consultation.

title.children: Government plaque naming wrong traditional owners 'quite upsetting', Barngarla people say

image.altText: Travis McElroy and his wife NoeleenÂ McKeag outside their home

props.synopsis: Delays in the housing construction industry are soon expected to ease. But that brings little relief to frustrated owners likeÂ Travis and Noeleen, whose build is already more than 600 days late.

title.children: Couple still waiting for dream home meant to be ready by Christmas â€” two years ago

image.altText: A close up of Imran Khan looking down and gesturing with his hands near a Pakistan flag.

props.synopsis: A Pakistani court indicts former prime minister Imran Khan on charges of leaking state secrets, a charge he denies.

title.children: Former Pakistan prime minister Imran Khan indicted

image.altText: A woman in a long coat, beanie, gloves, holding a dog, crying, next to a damaged building and burned car.

props.synopsis: Falling debris causes injuries and destruction in four of Kyiv's districts along the Dnipro River, with 18 people reportedly hospitalised.

title.children: Children among 53 injured as Russian missiles hit Kyiv apartments and children's hospital

image.altText: Worker in high vis standing next to a tunnel boring machine.

props.synopsis: A 143-metre-long tunnel boring machine working on the massive Snowy Hydro 2.0 project is moving again, a year after getting stuck and causing a large sinkhole.

title.children: Snowy Hydro tunnel boring machine moving a year after getting stuck

image.altText: A preserved, painted coffin from ancient egypt

props.synopsis: Have you ever wondered what the hook used to pull a brain through the nostrils of a person being mummified looks like? Or an actual mummified body, itself? Now's your chance to see both those things â€” and over 200 other ancient Egyptian artefacts, right here in Australia.

title.children: 'So special': 3,000 years of pharaohs, rulers, and everyday life on display in Canberra

image.altText: A woman wearing a black top.

props.synopsis: The NSW government has fast-tracked a development in Appin, south-west of Sydney, that it says will help address the state's housing crisis. But local residents fear they will be left stranded without infrastructure.Â

title.children: This little town is being rezoned to grow 13 times bigger but there's still no infrastructure plan

image.altText: A back view of a modern flood light at a sports stadium on a dark night.

props.synopsis: Queensland's incoming premier vows to review the $2.7 billion Gabba rebuild and promises "fresh faces" in a new-look cabinet once he is confirmed.

title.children: $2.7 billion Gabba rebuild in doubt as incoming premier signals major Olympic project review

image.altText: A surfer walking out of the ocean carrying a surfboard.

props.synopsis: A one-punch attacker's barrister tells a NSW court he was "triggered" by seeing the victim, who was a convicted child sex offender, with a young woman before the fatal assault.

title.children: Court hears man who killed former pro-surfer Chris Davidson wanted to protect children

image.altText: Operation Kudu 4

props.synopsis: Australian personnel who've been training Ukrainian military recruits will be welcomed home today as the government announces an expansion of the assistance mission.

title.children: Australia expands Ukraine military training mission, faces growing pressure to re-open embassy in Kyiv

image.altText: A landscape image of Jimmy Barnes wearing a black top. The background is out of focus but there is red, orange and blue light

props.synopsis: Jane Barnes announces her husband Jimmy is recovering from open heart surgery he needed after a bacterialÂ infection spread to his heart.

title.children: Musician Jimmy Barnes 'made it through' open heart surgery

image.altText: Two middle-aged women walk up the stairs of the NT Supreme Court in Darwin

props.synopsis: AÂ mother and son duo who tried to cover-upÂ the hit-and-run death of an Aboriginal woman by moving and burying most of her body in Darwin's rural area have been sentenced in the NT Supreme Court. The victim's leg was found on the side of the Stuart Highway last year.

title.children: Mother and son jailed for attempting to hide Indigenous woman's body following fatal hit-and-run
